stories.text: I'm working on a company in my spare time. I think it's going to take at least 6 months to a year to escape my corporate job and work on it full-time. At the same time I've been offered a position with higher pay but much higher responsibility, social pressure and time pressure at my current company. If my long-term goal is to leave and start my own company, should I take the new role and extra $20K per year or should I stay in my less demanding role and spend that extra time on my company? My savings are ~$7K so the $20K would be significant in helping pay living expenses while transitioning to a startup. Thoughts and experiences appreciated :)
stories.title: Money or time? What's more important while launching a startup on the side?

stories.text:
Both try to predict the future through seeing patterns. One uses the entire population and the stars while the other a database lookup.

Have a laugh and comment please
